titleStmt.title: Some remarks on the petition of the East-India Company to the House of Peers, against the bill sent up to their Lordships by the House of Commons, entituled, An act for granting to His Majesty two millions, &c. and for settling the trade to India

Some remarks on the petition of the East-India Company to the House of Peers, against the bill sent up to their Lordships by the House of Commons, entituled, An act for granting to His Majesty two millions, &c. and for settling the trade to India

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original at the Harvard University Library.
